etymology.description: 氵(氵) (shuǐ, "water") + 羊(羊) (yáng, "sheep") = vastness of water -> ocean; by extension -> foreign
etymology.interpretation: The character combines 氵(氵) (shuǐ, "water") to denote a connection to water and 羊(羊) (yáng, "sheep") for its phonetic value. The vastness associated with oceans was conceptually extended to anything foreign.

examples.chinese: 他喜欢洋服(他喜歡洋服)，认为它们时尚(認為它們時尚)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xǐhuān yángfú, rènwéi tāmen shíshàng.
examples.english: He likes foreign clothes and thinks they are trendy.

examples.chinese: 遥远的洋(遙遠的洋)隐藏着无数谜团(隱藏著無數謎團)。
examples.pinyin: Yáoyuǎn de yáng yǐncángzhe wúshù mítuán.
examples.english: The distant ocean conceals countless mysteries.

examples.chinese: 她听洋乐(她聽洋樂)，感受异国风情(感受異國風情)。
examples.pinyin: Tā tīng yángyuè, gǎnshòu yìguó fēngqíng.
examples.english: She listens to foreign music and experiences exotic charm.
